alert.note: Alert for San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 3:10PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL SOCORRO AND EAST CENTRAL CATRON COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 310 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of National Radio Astronomy Observatory, or 20 miles southeast of Datil, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... National Radio Astronomy Observatory. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 89 and 92. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southwest Mountains
